[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-ir-compiler/src/main.rs] [Function: main() script compilation block] [Type confusion] Can script compilation create type confusion between script arguments and module resources, potentially allowing scripts to access or modify resources they shouldn't have permission to touch? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-ir-compiler/src/main.rs] [Function: main() script compilation block] [Verification bypass] Does --no-verify for scripts allow bypassing critical safety checks like signature validation, sequence number checks, or gas limit enforcement? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-ir-compiler/src/main.rs] [Function: write_output()] [Path traversal] Can write_output() be exploited to write compiled bytecode to arbitrary filesystem locations by manipulating source_path.with_extension(), potentially overwriting validator configuration files or system binaries? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-ir-compiler/src/main.rs] [Function: write_output()] [File overwrite] Does write_output() check if the output file already exists? Can an attacker trigger compilation to overwrite critical system files or existing legitimate modules without warning? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-ir-compiler/src/main.rs] [Function: write_output()] [Symlink attack] If the output path is a symlink, does write_output() follow it and potentially write to an attacker-controlled location? Could this be used to overwrite validator keystores? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-ir-compiler/src/main.rs] [Function: write_output()] [Race condition - TOCTOU] Between creating the file handle and writing data, can an attacker replace the file with a symlink, causing the write to target a different location? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-ir-compiler/src/main.rs] [Function: write_output()] [Permission bypass] Does write_output() respect filesystem permissions? Can it be used to create files in directories where the user shouldn't have write access? (Medium)
